Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good mid-range phone, too bad only on AT&T;
Reviews.Author: Rocman
Reviews.Content: I've had a chance to use the HTC One Mini for the past month. As the name suggests, it's the little brother to the HTC One. Compared to its big brother, it's a little bit smaller in dimensions, with a smaller 4.3" 720P IPS screen, slower dual core CPU, 16GB memory and smaller battery at 1800mah. Honestly, I thought the phone would be a decent, but not great, device when I first picked it up, simply because of all the sacrifices for what appears to be a pretty minimal reduction in physical size. Yeah, it's actually not that smaller compared to the bigger HTC One.But I was pleasantly surprised. The phone is slightly shorter AND narrower than the HTC One. Even though it's still a fairly large device given the screen size, the reduction is just enough to make the phone easily usable with one hand. I can't stress this enough - this is the biggest (and probably only) advantage the Mini has over its big brother. Well, that and the price. It feels great in hand, and I don't have to stretch or reposition my hand and fingers to reach every corner of the screen. Big plus in ergonomics.The other compromises in tech specs are reasonable given the mid-range nature of the device. The slower CPU and smaller screen help to reduce the impact of the smaller battery - they use less juice. The resulting battery life is decent - I got through a day easily with average usage - about 2 to 2.5 hours on screen time, 4G LTE (60%) and wifi (40%). With heavier usage, you probably would need a quick recharge in the afternoon. The camera is largely the same as the Ultrapixel (large 2um pixel sensor) camera on the HTC One, with one exception - the Mini's camera doesn't come with optical image stabilization (OIS). OIS helps smooth out the shakes and vibrations when taking photos and videos. But I guess HTC had to differentiate the Mini a little bit from the more expensive One.The Sense 5 user interface is refined and subdued - classy and minimalist in nature compared to the cartoony Samsung Touchwiz and LG's. The phone feels buttery smooth in everyday use - no lag at all.The solid all-metal construction from the HTC One is here as well with one minor modification - the phone's edges has a plastic bumper. It takes a little bit away from the premium look, but it's otherwise identical to the One and blows every other Android phone out of the water.The dual speakers facing you is a large reason the phone is a bit bigger physically - you need the space for the speaker grills! But it's 100% worth it. This phone sounds every bit as good as the HTC One, and really is the BEST sounding smartphone on the market. Period. There's NOTHING that comes close. If you care about sound quality, this (and the HTC One) is the phone to get.Overall, this is a very well designed phone with good all-around performance. The mid range specs are reasonable since this is not a flagship phone, and is priced accordingly. It's really a shame that the phone isn't available on more carriers!

Reviews.Title: Best "mid range" phone there is bar none
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Wow I have never been so impressed with a so called mid range phone. I'm android loyal to the core and this phone just blows me away. I've had all the kinds my first was the HTC incredible. Which left me with a bad taste for HTC. Then a galaxy s2 skyrocket followed by an s3, nexus 4 and an LG optimus g pro. All of which were progressively better than the last. Is have to say the g pro was by far my favorite save for one thing. It's just to big for me.The HTC one mini is in no way a mini device unless your just talking specs compared to the ONE. But in no way does it feel like it's missing out on anything. Anyone looking to jump into the smartphone world should definitely consider this device. $79 is a steal if ask me. For a device that feels this good in hand and performs this well while being lumped in with the mid range croud. I am impressed and would highly recommend it to anyone who is thinking the flagship phone are to big. But get worried by what the specs are on paper. This really is a great device. I'm glad I gave HTC another go. The have really stepped it up.

Reviews.Title: This phone is AMAZING!!!
Reviews.Author: NyNy
Reviews.Content: I just got this phone yesterday and already I have set up all of my info and connected instantly to my important items. The response to the wifi is even better than my laptop! It connects to the wifi and stays on it. It's so simple to use, it's like using an iphone. Of course there are great apps from the android store you can download. The camera's 4 ultra pixels didn't get it's name for nothing! It's still just as great as the htc one.  The screen is in superb HD and it's the perfect size to use with one hand. I've had no problems typing with one hand.  The graphics on games are definitely a bonus. The beats audio are perfect and the speakers can get load, especially with headphones. Text messages are very flexible, so you can change the color of the texts bubbles and change the background picture to whatever you like. Phone calls are excellent quality. The other end can hear so clearly and strongly. One small problem is the keyboard is a problem if you have big hands/thumbs (I have rather medium to small hands and it's works fine for me but if you have big hands, you will have a problem with the keyboard) And another problem (it's minor) is that htc blink feed is rather limited with choices for display, but at least now you can link your twitter, facebook, and instagram to it with ease. Plus it does keep you rather updated with the biggest news that's happening right now. Other than that, the phone is the best I've ever had! Htc did well with this one! Mini is not the right name for this. It should be called Htc One 2!

Reviews.Title: Great smaller phone
Reviews.Author: Emily Liman
Reviews.Content: Great phone!  I got an iphone 5S, but returned it when I realized the new operating system made it impossible to see the phone keys and contacts.  The HTC one mini solves this problem and delivers more great features.  Keys are nice and bright (with good contrast) and everything is customizable - a BIG advantaged over the iphone.  Sound quality is excellent, especially when playing on the car stereo.  Great size/hand feel.  So far no complaints!

Reviews.Title: Impressed by the Best
Reviews.Author: Best of the best
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my HTC One Mini. After expressing my dislike of my previous upgrade to the Sony Xpheria to AT&T; customer representative, and explaining that I am long time customer and no way I could continue with this phone for 2 years never been so unhappy with any of my phone choices as I was with the Sony Xpheria. Looking on line I see the HTC One mini and knew I wanted it right away. The features are awesome, picture quality awesome, speaker sound awesome, battery life awesome, size awesome, overall everything about this phone is awesome. AT&T; has made me a happy customer, best choice I made in phones. Get it you will make an awesome choice.

Reviews.Title: First Smart phone
Reviews.Author: Linda Wade
Reviews.Content: I bought the mini to avoid having a very large device to carry and keep up with. The screen is large enoughand as I learn more about operating it and using the many features it is worth the upgrade. I like the clear, distinct soundand tutorials and other than making the transition to a smart phone it has been worth the money. I see no needfor a phone with the larger screen. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: Very happy, but wish it had SD card slot
Reviews.Author: M. Heath Howe "howepc"
Reviews.Content: This phone is quick, has great sound, and does everything your average user would need except to allow for storage expansion. Unless I start to shoot a lot of video, I may never use it, but it would be nice to have the option. It's very slim and sleek, and paired with the Poetic Atmosphere case, it looks great and works beautifully carried in my front pocket.

Reviews.Title: Love This Phone
Reviews.Author: Hpygrl2
Reviews.Content: I love the size, it's small enough not to be too clunky but big enough that I can see everything clearly. Lot's of features and apps.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Phone
Reviews.Author: love to read
Reviews.Content: I am really happy that I found this phone. It fits me perfectly. I might not be tech savvy but I have become very attached to my new phone.  Excellent Purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!!!
Reviews.Author: Brandee Bahnmiller
Reviews.Content: Love my htc one mini!!!! It is the best phone i have ever owner. love the beats audio and how fast it is

Reviews.Title: Good functionality, but terrible design flaw
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Skeens "SV"
Reviews.Content: The phone is great.  It fits well in my hand and quickly reacts to my demands.  However, after using it for only 2 days there are 10, yes TEN cracks in the plastic.  No, I do not abuse the phone. It actually sits on my desk at work all day then has a comfortable ride home in a cup holder with a phone cradle and I haven't dropped it.  I am quite surprised that this hasn't been addressed on an other Amazon reviews because the issues seems to be rampant when searching online.  I am getting it replaced, but if the second one is anything close to this, I will have to find another phone.It is a great phone if you aren't bothered by cracks.  Great screen quality and decent battery life.

Reviews.Title: HTC One Mini must be on your list to consider
Reviews.Author: David Knokey
Reviews.Content: Very happy that I decided to purchase the HTC One Mini.  It has a wonderful display, excellent speed and offers most of the features that today's users demand.  The phone has a nice heavy feel in-hand with quality construction. If you are looking for a new phone this one must be on your list to consider.

Reviews.Title: HTC One Mini Review
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Moore "Bob"
Reviews.Content: After I updated the operating system to Jellybean 4.2.2 sense 5.0 I like the phone. But there will be several more improvements in Kitkat 4.4.2 sense 5.5 sometime early 2014. With the update you will be able to turnoff BlinkFeed rather then just hide it. BlinkFeed streams updates to all your selected social media to your home screen. Although this looks cool you need an unlimited data account or only all data updates when you have a WiFi connection.

Reviews.Title: small size great specs
Reviews.Author: anthony
Reviews.Content: Awesome phone.  Best phone with smaller screen since most others are  4.7 inches or larger.  Better specs than galaxy 3 mini and all other mini's out there besides the boring iPhone.  I would reccommend to anyone needing a smaller sized phone.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone!
Reviews.Author: peteygrizz
Reviews.Content: After using this phone for about 3 months I am still impressed by it.  Although it may not be the high end device some people desire I find it works terrifically for me.  The build quality is outstanding all seams and lines are tight and smooth.  The screen looks amazing and the size is perfect; feels very comfortable to hold and fits nicely into a shirt pocket. I am extremely satisfied with this device and would certainly purchase again..

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone!
Reviews.Author: Humza Ahmed
Reviews.Content: Great phone for my dad: hist first smartphone. Beautiful design and interface. Looks sleek and feels very comfortable in one hand. The speakers are awesome!!

Reviews.Title: Great design and amazing features.
Reviews.Author: Young Joon Park
Reviews.Content: I guess HTC finally came up with a device that can compete against Samsung and Apple.The design is more towards Apple while the platform is as good as (still not better than) Samsung galaxy S4.

Reviews.Title: Really happy w/my first contract phone.
Reviews.Author: Not Hidden
Reviews.Content: I got this because I like my friend's regular HTC One, but that one is too big for my small hands.  Wasn't going to add music due to the low storage space but got a taste of Beats Audio and now I'm REALLY hooked.  Sounds a MILLION times better than my iPod.  It's been about 2 wks, and I have no complaints about this phone at all.  Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love the HTC One Mini!
Reviews.Author: mzAngel29
Reviews.Content: Great cell phone! The upgrade process worked great, phone was delivered in 3 days! Great discounted price too! I was able to sync my contacts from my old phone to the HTC One Mini through the bluetooth and it worked great!

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Glen A Schneider
Reviews.Content: Phone works great.  HTC did a great job with this one.  Fits my hand perfectly.  Can easily use and type with one hand.

Reviews.Title: best for a small size phone
Reviews.Author: Sravani
Reviews.Content: The screen corners is over sensitive. ANd sometimes just moving your hand over the over creates the touch effect and the app opens.Great camera and sound

Reviews.Title: Sweet!
Reviews.Author: Emma Stuart
Reviews.Content: totally awesome phone, was not a problem getting it set up and figured out, very nice. love the design and all around style of this phone

Reviews.Title: Good phone overall
Reviews.Author: S. Delgado "SD"
Reviews.Content: Very nice looking phone. Operates fast and flawlessly. After having it for about a month now there are just a few minor things I think should be improved. There is a lot of hype about the speakers, but they really aren't that loud. The picture quality of the camera is ok, but could be better. But, overall, for $.01 with 2 year contract, I am still happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Hey HTC, it's supposed to be a phone!
Reviews.Author: Edward S. Tipper "STSailor"
Reviews.Content: First and foremost this is supposed to be a phone, and that it is not very good at being.  Lousy antenna, bars shift from one to four and back while not moving.  Calls drop where my old not-smart phone worked fine.  Sometimes I can hear my caller quite clearly, but they can not hear me at all.  Zero.  So if you want, you know, a phone, skip this one.I like the android OS, but hate that there are pre-loaded apps likeFaceBook that you can not delete.  Average battery life.  The notification light that is supposed to go on when you get a message or phone voicemail is inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: The One !.!.!
Reviews.Author: V.A. Dalton
Reviews.Content: Thank you, "Amazon " My son bought his HTC from AT&T; store for a whole lot more, then mine from you. This smart phone is smarter than me, but I have a friend at work who know everything  ( electronics, headset, cellphone flat tv everything) and I am learning all the ins & outs of the HTC from him and it is great all the thing it can do. ( IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A PHONE THAT HAS EVERYTHING, RESEARCH THEM ALL, AND YOU WILL COME BACK TO THE HTC ONE AND MINI ) at a unbelievable price from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: HTC mini awful
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M Giddings
Reviews.Content: First of all I was told it comes with headphones  and it doesn't (bought from ATT).  The battery is pathetic.  I have to charge it at least once a day.  If I use an app the battery lasts less then 3 hours. So I called HTC customer service and they suggested I should turn off pretty much everything and only turn on when I want to actively use it.  So, I asked what's the point in having a smart phone if I have to turn it all off and they replied that would be the way to make the battery last longer.  Now when I receive a phone call the caller can't hear me speak.  So I call customer service again and they have me go through a bunch of different tests to see if what's wrong.  Can't figure it out so he tells me he will open an inquiry and I should check for software updates daily to see if they send me one.  After 3 days of no updates I call again.  She has no clue what I'm talking about so I have to do the tests again.  Now they want me to send the phone in and within 7-10 days they may have an answer.  So with shipping it could be 2 weeks without any phone.  And they don't supply a loaner phone.  Who goes 2 weeks without having a phone I asked.  No response.  BTW this phone is still under warranty.  Also, I tried to post this review on the HTC site but they emailed me and said they don't allow critical reviews to be posted.

Reviews.Title: OMG, WOW...BEST HTC PHONE YET...ITS THE 1...LOL
Reviews.Author: CHEF CROMER
Reviews.Content: ONLY PART U MAY NOT LIKE IS THE FACT IT WILL NOT EXCEPT EXTERNAL MICROSD CARD, ONLY COMES WITH 16GIGS OF MEMORY...AN THATS GOOD ENOUGH FOR ME, UNLESS UR N2 DOWNLOADING MUSIC VIDEO'S(WHICH TAKE UP A LOT OF MEMORY)....BUT FOR MUSIC, ITS REALLY GOOD...CONNECT AND DOWNLOAD & SHARE IS REALLY EASY TOO...AS FAR BLUTOOTH PAIRING, IT A DREAM, BUT HERE'S THE SITUATION, IF U WANT TO TRANSFER UR CONTACTS FROM PREVIOUS PHONE, TO THIS NEW HTC 1 MINI, THEN THATS SO SERIOUSLY EASY TO DO...IT HAS A TRANSFER APP IN THE SETTINGS DEPT.....I WAS UNAWARE @ 1ST, BUT SOON CAUGHT ON...HERES WHATS FUNNY, MY PEOPLES KEPT SAYING"NO,GET THE SAMSUNG GALX4", BUT I ONCE AGAIN FOR THE SECOND TIME REFUSED! I RREALLY LIKE HTC, MUCH BETTER THAN APPLE i4 & i5/S! BUT SAMSUNG IS #1, HTC IS # 2/3/4/5/6/7, U GET MY POINT..HAHAEXTREMELY GREAT GOOD PHONE, AN ULL LOVE IT AS WELL

Reviews.Title: I phone that has to be unlocked in order to answer it sucks.
Reviews.Author: D.G. "Gris1"
Reviews.Content: This phone locks itself after a maximum time of 15 minutes and must be unlocked in order the answer an incoming call, not very convenient if your on the go even with a hands free headset you still have to pick up the phone in order to unlock it!!! The camera sucks. The only great feature is the duel speakers. Not a great phone. I am going back to the plain simple and secure Blackberry sorry I tried to jump ship it proves that the grass is not greener on the other side.
